questions.skill: Identify properties of quadratic functions from their graphs or equations
questions.question: The function f(x) = (x - 4)² - 9 is graphed in the xy-plane. What is the minimum value of f(x)?
questions.explanation: The function is in vertex form f(x) = (x - h)² + k, where the vertex is (h, k). Here, the vertex is (4, -9). Since the coefficient of (x - 4)² is positive, the parabola opens upward, so the minimum value is -9.
